description: Borrowed from French autocrate, itself from Ancient Greek αὐτοκρατής (autokratḗs, “sovereign”), from αὐτο- (auto-, “self”) (combinatory form of αὐτός (autós)) + κρατία (kratía, “rule”) (from κράτος (krátos, “strength, power”)).

entries.meaning: An absolute ruler with infinite power.
examples: Synonyms: autocrator, despot, dictator, monarch, tyrant, strongman

entries.meaning: A title borne by some such monarchs, as in Byzantium and tsarist Russia.
Until the 20th century, a favorable description of a ruler who was connected with the concept of lack of conflicts of interest and an indication of grandeur and power.
